name: electricity production, oil | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/27097/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in an average oil power plant in India - Goa (a state/union territory in India) in 2012.;This dataset is created as a child of the global dataset, i.e. some of the values are inherited from the global dataset and some are country-specific. Following values are edited, because they are country specific: the annual production volume, input of fuel, thermal efficiency of the power plant, and emission of CO2. Other emissions are, in general, calculated/estimated based on the weighted average of emissions in all datasets in version 2 (which are considered as the global values) multiplied with an efficiency scaling factor. The datasets in version 2 were valid for the following countries: AT, BE, BR, GR, CN, CS, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, GR, HR, HU, IE, IT, JP, MK, NL, NO, PT, PL, SE, SI, SK. Weighting was made with electricity production data in those countries based on IEA/OECD 2010. The weighted averages are taken as global values and then scaled with a factor derived from the comparison of the global average efficiency and the efficiency valid for this dataset in order to account for a higher or lower fuel input for the production of 1 kWh, respectively.;Comments:; - sulfur content of the oil is not adapted to local/average conditions.; - CO2 emissions are presented for the combustion and are collected from data provided by CO2 Baseline Database for the Indian Power Sector.; -  Extensive comments on emissions can be found in Jungbluth 2007, on which this dataset is based on.;Sources:;CEA. (2014). CO2 Baseline Database for the Indian Power Sector. User Guide, Ministry of Power, Government of India, New Delhi. Retrieved 12 04, 2016, from http://cea.nic.in/reports/others/thermal/tpece/cdm_co2/user_guide_ver10.pdf;IEA/OECD. 2010. Electricity Information 2010. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR). Part IV. Detailed OECD Electricity And Heat Data.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - electricity production, oil, IN, 1980 - 2015 (c5b47c2e-c1a9-4350-8642-d7e57ac5c8f9)]

From the constructed power plant ready to produce electricity and from the fuel ready to be used.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar.

This dataset includes all energy use, use of chemicals, emissions to air and water  In an oil power plant, water is needed for cooling, feed water for the steam circuit, for the flue gas treatment, or other cleaning. This dataset only considers water use (evaporation) for cooling and steam circuit.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume data for the period 01.04.2012 - 31.03.2013.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Electricity production in a conventional oil power plant with a capacity of 500 MWe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The exchanges - except CO2 emission and heavy fuel oil consumption - in this datasets are a weighted average of the following country oil datasets in the ecoinvent database (weighting with electricity production):  AT, BE, BR, GR, CN, CS, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, GB, GR, HR, HU, IE, IT, JP, MK, NL, NO, PT, PL, SE, SI, SK.  For details see comment for parameter "average efficiency of oil power plants, global". Child exchanges are put into relation to the parent exchanges by means of average efficiency of oil power plants in the country and global average efficiency of oil power plants.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The inventory is generated using statistical data, literature data, and modelling.

flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

EMEP: Co-operative Programme for Monitoring and Evaluation of the Long Range Transmission of Air Pollutants in Europe, CORINAIR: The Core Inventory of Air Emissions in Europe, EEA: European Environment Agency, Copenhagen, DK.

flow.name: Acetaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Calculated value. In case of oil power plants, CO2 emission data were available. However, the oil consumption data were not available. Hence, we reverse calculated the oil consumption as CO2 emission divided by the product of net calorific value (34.64 MJ/kg) and CO2 emission factor (0.0726 kg/MJ).

flow.name: Chromium VI
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Calculated/Literature value. The emission value is calculated as weighted average (based on the production volume) of CO2 emission from the diesel generator power plants of this particular state/union territory. CO2 emission data from the specific diesel generator power plants is collected from the Central Electricity Authority (CEA) CO2 Baseline Database for the Indian Power Sector.
